Posts.Content: Hi. Had robotic prostatectomy in January 2017. Following this, developed extreme discomfort/pain in rectal area. Called urologist to get renew Rx for pain. He said go to ER but having worked on ambulance, didnt want to do that-too much paranoia re:drug seekers. Finally got in to see family doc. He gave me antibiotic. First relief in pain but only lasted a few days. Finally got in to my regular doc and he prescribed procto-foam. After a course of that ,pain subsided but condition persists. Manifested by feeling of always needing to have bowel movement but nothing or tiny results. On internet found term tenesmus which described problem exactly. Referred to surgeon to do endoscopy but instead, he told me I had levator syndrome. He did a massage of the levator muscle but hasnt helped. Going to go back to my regular doc to try to figure things out but just wondering if anyone else with rectal issues post-prostatectomy?
Posts.Title: Tenesmus?
